dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: HA! Oh my god, B, did you see this article? This is… it’s insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: H A! Oh my god, B, did you see this article? This is... it's insane!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Insane? What, uh, what's got you so worked up now? Another clickbait headline?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane? What, uh, what's got you so worked up now? Another clickbait headline?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Clickbait? It's Goldman Sachs, B! They're literally calling it "A Looming Apocalypse" for oil companies!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Clickbait? It's Goldman Sachs, B! They're literally calling it A Looming Apocalypse for oil companies!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citi, an investment bank, noted the industry-wide decline of reserves in a research note published last week under the headline: Falling IOC Reserves A Looming Challenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Apocalypse? That's a bit dramatic, don't you think? Like, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apocalypse? That's a bit dramatic, don't you think? Like, come on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Dramatic? Their reserves have plummeted by seventy-five percent since 2015! Seventy-five! They're down to three years of annual production. Three years, B!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dramatic? Their reserves have plummeted by seventy-five percent since twenty fifteen! Seventy-five! They're down to three years of annual production. Three years, B!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since 2015 the average reserves of the oil majors has fallen by 25% to now stand at less than 10 years of annual production.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the article itself says the SEC measurements are, quote, "completely unreliable." So, like, how much stock are we really putting into these numbers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the article itself says the S E C measurements are, quote, completely unreliable. So, like, how much stock are we really putting into these numbers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bank said that while Securities and Exchange Commission measurements had some failings they provided a clear picture of an industry that is struggling to make itself competitive in a world of lower oil prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Irrelevant! Goldman Sachs reviewed their own annual reports. They're saying these IOCs, uh, they're incapable of transition, facing "complete economic failure"!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Irrelevant! Goldman Sachs reviewed their own annual reports. They're saying these IOCs, uh, they're incapable of transition, facing complete economic failure!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citi, an investment bank, noted the industry-wide decline of reserves in a research note published last week under the headline: Falling IOC Reserves A Looming Challenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Incapable? They're the biggest companies in the world. They'll just... find more oil. Or, you know, adapt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Incapable? They're the biggest companies in the world. They'll just... find more oil. Or, you know, adapt.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Adapt how? One CEO explicitly said "black has failed and green won't work either"! Eighty percent of cash flow from operations, gone! Due to poor management! That’s not adapting, that’s, uh, collapsing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Adapt how? One C E O explicitly said black has failed and green won't work either! Eighty percent of cash flow from operations, gone! Due to poor management! That's not adapting, that's, uh, collapsing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the recent words of one IOC chief executive black pays for green a reference to the 80% of CFFO (cash flow from operations) that is generated from oil and gas activities, and likely to still be more than 70% by 2030, Citi said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: See, that's just a single quote. I mean, are we really supposed to believe ExxonMobil and Shell are on the verge of bankruptcy? That's just wild speculation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See, that's just a single quote. I mean, are we really supposed to believe ExxonMobil and Shell are on the verge of bankruptcy? That's just wild speculation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wild speculation? They name names! Total, BP, Chevron, ExxonMobil, ConocoPhillips... all have reserves around two years! Two! They're facing "complete financial collapse."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild speculation? They name names! Total, B P, Chevron, ExxonMobil, ConocoPhillips... all have reserves around two years! Two! They're facing complete financial collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citi said there were two clear groups forming across the oil sector with six IOCs tightly grouped around reserve life of around 10.5 years. They are: Total, BP, Chevron, ENI, ConocoPhillips and ExxonMobil.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but that's a small group, maybe they just had, like, a bad year. Other companies are still fine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but that's a small group, maybe they just had, like, a bad year. Other companies are still fine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Shell and Equinor's reserves are soon to become zero! The article calls it a "death knell"! How much more clear can it be? This isn't just a bad year, it's, uh, the end!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shell and Equinor's reserves are soon to become zero! The article calls it a death knell! How much more clear can it be? This isn't just a bad year, it's, uh, the end!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are three IOCs in another group (Repsol, Equinor and Shell) which have reserves around eight years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, I just... I think it's completely overblown. These companies have survived for decades, they're not just going to, like, vanish.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, I just... I think it's completely overblown. These companies have survived for decades, they're not just going to, like, vanish.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You really think a seventy-five percent drop in reserves, B, is "overblown"? You're out of your mind!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You really think a seventy-five percent drop in reserves, B, is overblown? You're out of your mind!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since 2015 the average reserves of the oil majors has fallen by 25% to now stand at less than 10 years of annual production.
